intro: Chusua, commonly known as the golden weed, is a flowering plant native to various regions in Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in wetlands, along riverbanks, and in coastal areas. Chusua has small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually alternate and lance-shaped. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
